clinical_study.brief_title: Clinic Trial in Phase 1 Using Amniotic Membrane for the Skin Replacement in Big Wounds
clinical_study.official_title: Clinic Trial in Phase 1 Using Amniotic Membrane for the Skin Replacement in Big Wounds

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundacion para la Formacion e Investigacion Sanitarias de la Region de Murcia

clinical_study.source: Fundacion para la Formacion e Investigacion Sanitarias de la Region de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety of use of a new therapeutic strategy for the treatment of patients with large wounds

detailed_description.textblock: Amniotic membrane (AM) is a useful tissue as a biological dressing with numerous advantages it has a very similar structure to the skin and his biological and immunological properties.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.description: anti Human Leukocyte Antigen 1 (HLA1),Short Tandem Repeat (STRS) detection
Transforming growth factor beta 1 or Transforming growth factor beta (TGFB),wound biopsy

arm_group.description: The wound will be washed with saline and debrided if necessary. Control microbiological cultures will be taken and applied amniotic membrane fragments sufficient to cover the wound, putting in contact the basement membrane of the AM with granulation tissue

intervention.description: The wound will be washed with saline and debrided if necessary. Control microbiological cultures will be taken and applied amniotic membrane fragments sufficient to cover the wound, putting in contact the basement membrane of the AM with granulation tissue
